p: Healthy cladodes and flowers of the invasive plant O. dillenii were collected from the Bundala National Park in the South-East arid zone of Sri Lanka on July 2013. The samples were tightly sealed in polythene bags under humid conditions and kept at room temperature. The plant was identified using a detailed guide [ 14] and confirmed by comparing with the voucher specimen No. 12687 at the National Herbarium, Royal Botanical Garden, Peradeniya, Sri Lanka. The isolation of the fungal endophytes commenced within 24Â hours of collection.
